Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • Graph

  • public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Graph Contains all the information concerning to the graph
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Agustin & Facundo

      Builds graph and calls all necessary methods to give user what he wants

        slicing_point - a string which indicates the point where slicing should be started
        list - list of variables involved in slicing process

    • Method Detail

      • addVertex

        public void addVertex(Vertex vertex)
        Adds a new vertex into graph's list of vertexes
        Parameters:
        vertex - new vertex to be added

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if graph's list of vertexes is empty
        Returns:
        • true: graph's list of vertexes is empty
        • false: graph's list of vertexes is not empty

      • getVertexes

        public java.util.LinkedList<Vertex> getVertexes()
        Outputs this graph's vertexes
        Returns:
        linked list made of vertexes

      • makeGraph

        public java.lang.String makeGraph()
        Builds graph and calls all necessary methods to give user what he wants
        Returns:
        a string representing the slicing point, in case that this line number does not exist and user has to be warned

      • writePath

        public void writePath(java.lang.String path)
        Creates file named '.paths.txt' and writes string 'path' into it
        Parameters:
        path - a string containing all paths within this graph

      • Slice

        public void Slice(java.util.ArrayList<Pair<Node,Node>> pairs)
        Builds a DOT file called 'Slice.dot' within .output_intermediate folder representing the output sliced graph
        Parameters:
        pairs - an array list made of pairs containing nodes

      • isAncestor

        public boolean isAncestor(Vertex ver)
        A vertex called 'ver' is given as a parameter, returns true if the second component of the vertex is an ancestor of the first component of the vertex
        Parameters:
        ver - a vertex of this graph
        Returns:
        • true: second component of the vertex is an ancestor of first component of the vertex
        • false: second component of the vertex is not an ancestor of first component of the vertex

      • leastCommonAncestor

        public java.lang.String leastCommonAncestor(Vertex v)
        Given a vertex 'v', searches for the least common ancestor of both nodes contained within the vertex
        Parameters:
        v - a vertex made of nodes
        Returns:
        a string representing the least common ancestor

      • markLCA

        public void markLCA(Vertex v,
           Node n)
        Sets node 'n' passed as a parameter to be the least common ancestor for some nodes within this graph starting from the second component of vertex 'v' passed as a parameter
        Parameters:
        v - a vertex
        n - a node

      • changeExitForStart

        public void changeExitForStart()
        Changes the least common ancestor for those nodes whose least common ancestor is node 'exit' for node 'start'

      • CFGToDot

        public void CFGToDot()
        Builds a DOT file called 'CFG.dot' within .output_intermediate folder representing the output CFG

      • readAllPaths

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Node>> readAllPaths()
        Reads all paths within this graph opening file .paths.txt
        Returns:
        an array list made of array lists containing nodes

      • dfs

        public java.lang.String dfs(Node n,
                   java.lang.String path,
                   int successorNumber)
        Searches recursively for all different paths within the graph starting from node 'n'
        Parameters:
        n - a node from this graph
        path - a string representing the partial path
        successorNumber - integer indicating the number of successors of node 'n'
        Returns:
        a string with all different paths together

      • dfs2

        public java.lang.String dfs2(Node n,
                    java.lang.String path,
                    int successorNumber)
        Searches recursively for all different paths within the graph starting from node 'n'
        Parameters:
        n - a node from this graph
        path - a string representing the partial path
        successorNumber - integer indicating the number of successors of node 'n'
        Returns:
        a string with all different paths together
